Text.desc: These are phone apps that I'd recommend doing. I chose them based on how useful and enjoyable they are to use.
Text.desc2: These are apps that I think would be worth downloading.
Text.email: Email yourself all these download links.
Text.desc3: These are popular apps that you have probably already downloaded.

AppsToDownload.Name: Genius Scan
AppsToDownload.Description: Used to Scan papers using your camera and turn them into pdfs. Recommended by one of my old math professors at UNCW. I found it extremely useful when I was in college. Would highly recommend.

AppsToDownload.Name: LinkedIn
AppsToDownload.Description: I think it's good to use the app to see notifications, job alerts, etc. I also feel like the app is a little easier to use than the website.

AppsToDownload.Name: Handshake
AppsToDownload.Description: This is the app UNCW uses for job searching. It's like their version of linkedin.

AppsToDownload.Name: Alarmy
AppsToDownload.Description: This is the alarm app I use. I really like the UI, the sound it uses, and the overall features.

AppsToDownload.Name: Coursicle
AppsToDownload.Description: Allows you to track the open status of courses. Will send you a notification when a class goes from closed to open.

AppsToDownload.Name: Waze
AppsToDownload.Description: This is the GPS app I use. It's extremely useful when driving. It can calculate the most optimal routes and redirect you if you go the wrong way.

AppsToDownload.Name: SafeZone
AppsToDownload.Description: This is the new app UNCW uses to send out alerts about hurricanes and stuff as of August 2024.

AppsToDownload.Name: Google Maps
AppsToDownload.Description: I feel like this is a good app to use a Walking GPS. I prefer Waze for driving though.

AppsToDownload.Name: GitHub
AppsToDownload.Description: Can be used to help with authentication and allows you to access your repositories on your phone.

AppsToDownload.Name: Microsoft Teams
AppsToDownload.Description: My CSC 450 used this app to communicate during the class in a similar way to Slack.

AppsToDownload.Name: Uber
AppsToDownload.Description: You probably already know what this is, but I'll describe it anyway. It's basically a taxi service app. You can order an uber/taxi at basically ANY location and it will come pick you up and drive you around. This was very helpful when I needed to get a drug test for my job when I was in Wilmington and didn't have a car. I also think the UI is super cool which is a bonus. Would definitely recommend it.

AppsToDownload.Name: AllTrails
AppsToDownload.Description: This is a search tool to find hiking trails in your area. You can find trails and leave reviews.

AppsToDownload.Name: PayByPhone Parking
AppsToDownload.Description: If you ever go somewhere that has paid parking, this is a really good app to have. It seems to be the most widely used app for paid parking.

AppsToDownload.Name: AWS Console
AppsToDownload.Description: Allows you to easily see billing and information about running services.

AppsToDownload.Name: Amtrak
AppsToDownload.Description: This is an app for finding trains. While I wouldn't find it useful if I lived in Wilmington, I do find it very useful in RTP. You can sometimes get places faster, cheaper, safer, etc. than in an uber. I use it to get from Durham to Charlotte.

Kinda Obviously.Name: Canvas
Kinda Obviously.Description: Manage your UNCW assignments, view grades, future assignments, etc.

Kinda Obviously.Name: Duo Mobile
Kinda Obviously.Description: Used for two-factor authentication at UNCW and many other places.

Kinda Obviously.Name: Microsoft Outlook
Kinda Obviously.Description: Manage your UNCW email and other outlook emails
